fields.description:
h5. Summary
Commenting on issue (without transitioning) changes the color of issue Status in Customer portal

h5. Step to Reproduce
# Create issue in service desk customer portal
# Perform any transition
# Comment in the issue
!cp2.png|thumbnail!
# Refresh the customer portal page
!cp1.png|thumbnail!

h5. Expected Result
The color of issue status does not change

h5. Actual Result
The color of issue status gets changed for the issue which is commented (without transitioning). While the color of issue status remains the same for issue that was not commented.
!cp3.png|thumbnail!

I raised it as a bug ticket as there is no documentation that mention/justify this behavior.
fields.summary: Commenting on issue (without transitioning) changes the color of issue Status in Customer portal

fields.description:
For a project we have configured a custom filed with the following settings:
* User Picker (multiple users)
* Issue type: Global (all issues)
* Projects: restricted only to the project with the service desk
* The field appears on the default screen for the project

Moreover, we have around 600 users that can access JIRA, but only 150 of them have done it so far - so 150 are active and the rest are marked as "Not recorded" in the "Login Details" column of the system user management.

Now, when visiting the service desk, the above field is shown as expected. However, when we search for users, only users that have logged in at least once to JIRA, are displayed as search result. When we search for a user that has never logged in to JIRA (i.e. has state "Not recorded" as described above) service desk won't list the user as a search result. But as soon as the user logs in at least once the user is displayed as result.

On the other hand, when we try to open a new issue of the same type and in the same project for which the service desk is configured for, we can search for any user in our custom field - and every searched user is found (no matter if he has ever logged in or not).

For us, this is a major issue that service desk doesn't display all users that are allowed to log into the system.

Our current JIRA version is 6.3.14 (updated in early February '15). Our current JIRA Service Desk version is 2.3.0 (most recent as of writing this bug report).
fields.summary: User Picker custom field won't show all users on service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1569].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating Issues along with Image Signature by Apple Mail or any other Email service which includes the attachment in body of mail and not footer(Gmail can be configured properly in footer), Creates Attachments

h3. Environment 
Using Apple Mail to create issue in JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
When user is using Apple Mail to send an email to JIRA SD in order to create issues, if there is any signature on that email regardless of the image being inside the body of email or in the footer of the email. JIRA creates attachments 
Image signatures of the emails by Apple Mail appear as attachment in the ticket. So, multiple replies may create many attachments which need to be removed manually and it triggers the issue update event which results in receiving unwanted notification to users.  

Below is the part of the original message from Apple Mail, which shows that the image signature will be sent as part of content of the mail, not footer.
{code}
--Apple-Mail=_4A78E496-79D6-4AEB-BB9D-EBAA25EF99D9
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-Disposition: inline;
	filename="AF04260C-C4F8-4357-9410-25719D1D08C8[18].png"
Content-Type: image/png;
	name="AF04260C-C4F8-4357-9410-25719D1D08C8[18].png"
Content-Id: <79034FE9-D9CF-4811-93FC-C499B27C81DC@rhodon.com>
{code}
and below is the part of the mail which has been sent using Gmail and it can be seen that the image is in footer and will be ignored by JIRA and does not create any attachments
{code}
--001a1134b9644e9875050fdeae4d
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8

This has an image as the footer.

*USERNAME*
*Support Engineer*
LOCATION AND PHONE NUMBER

--001a1134b9644e9875050fdeae4d
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The expect result is any image other than those in footer to be added as an attachment, but it does not happen by Apple mail
fields.summary: Creating Issues along with Image Signature by Apple Mail, Gmail and  etc, Creates Attachments

Our company policy doesn't allow to delete any issues so I modified Service Desk permission scheme - I removed almost all *Delete Issues* permission entries. 
Now I got warning that *This service desk project may not work as expected.* (screens attached)
This dialog is visible all the time for both Project Administrators and Agents.
Additionally Project Administrators can revert JIRA Administrator's changes. According to me they shouldn't have such possibility but it is another issue.

I think that such changes should be possible and notification should be displayed only once just after change and disappear after confirmation and shouldn't bothering other people especially agents who doesn't have to know technical aspects.

Let's say you have an request type "access" where customers can request user accounts for a specific system.
You have fields like:
* First name
* Last name
* Role
* Location
* Permission multi select list
* Cost centre
* Department

This works great for 1 request but it takes to long if a customer requests access for multiple colleagues. 

It would be great to have the "create another" feature from normal jira view with a little bit more control where you can say "keep this fields" per request type.

fields.description:
h4. This feature request is for both Jira Service Desk and Jira Software and happens even if Confluence and Jira share the same user base.
h4. Steps to Replicate on Jira Service Desk

Link Jira Software or JIRA Service Desk with Confluence as per the document below:
 - [Providing self-help resources for your customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Providing+self-help+resources+for+your+customers+with+a+knowledge+base]

Detailed steps:
 # Install the latest JIRA (6.3.15) with Service Desk (2.2.1) and Confluence (5.7) versions.
 # Configure an Application Link with 2-Legged OAuth Authentication (2LOA) between the applications.
 # Create a Service Desk and link it to a Confluence Space.
 # Create a KB article on the Confluence space.
 # Log out of both applications and access the customer portal.
 # After performing a search, the relevant KB articles titles are displayed:
 !search.png|thumbnail! 
 # Clicking on the relevant article will open a pop-up asking for the user to log into Confluence to browse the KB Article.
  !login.png|thumbnail! 

Having to login into Confluence to browse the article details defeats the purpose of setting up an Application Link for authentication.

*Steps to Replicate on Jira Software:*

1) Create application link from Confluence to Jira Software

2) Link Confluence space to a particular project in Jira as per the guide below:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2017/03/linking-confluence-spaces-to-jira-software-projects]

3) In an article residing in that space - add a link to a Jira Issue

4) Log Out from Confluence

5) In JIRA, open the issue referenced in Confluence at  step 3 above, locate the link to the Confluence page and open it. Jira will prompt user to enter Confluence credentials.

h3. Note:
{panel:borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#ebfbf4| bgColor=#edeff1}
The fix for this problem is released with Jira service desk 4.6.0 and confluence 7.1

To resolve this issue, please upgrade Jira service desk to version 4.6.0 or higher and Confluence to version 7.1 or higher

Jira Service Desk 4.6.0 was released on 17 December 2019 and Confluence 7.1 was released on 4 November 2019.
{panel}
fields.summary: You need to log in to Confluence to view Knowledge Base articles

fields.description: We are currently running JIRA 6.3.11 (server install) with Service Desk 2.2.1 (also a server install) and we created a new JIRA project to test Service Desk.  When a customer submits a help request using the customer portal the request generates the appropriate JIRA ticket.  However, the when the customer clicks on the 'My Requests' link nothing shows up.  Also, when we go to the project and view the list of Customers, the count for 'Open Requests' and 'Closed Requests' shows zero even after these customers have submitted help requests.  I have tried using a new customer account created from the customer portal and the behavior is the same.
fields.summary: Submitted customer requests not showing in 'My Requests', Open/Closed count

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1540].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Resolve/Close request transitions in a Service Desk instance do not trigger the appropriate notifications to Agents/JIRA Users according to the notification scheme.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Define users/groups under the Issue Resolved and/or Issue Closed notification settings of a Service Desk project's notification scheme.
# Create a Service Desk request in the Service Desk of step 1
# Resolve the request of step 2

h3. Expected Results
The users or members of the group as defined under step 1 should receive notifications of the request being resolved

h3. Actual Results
The members of the group or entities do not receive any notifications of the request resolution

h3. Root cause
In the Service Desk default generated workflow, the transition that resolves requests fires a Generic Event in the transition post-functions.
The notification scheme however acts on the Issue Resolved event. Since this is not defined in the post-functions, no notifications will be send.

h3. Workaround
There are 2 possible workarounds for this issue.
# Add the users/groups in the notification scheme to the "Generic Event" instead of the "Issue Resolved" notification. This will however trigger notifications on all Generic Events within that project to the defined user/groups
# In the relevant workflows, change the "Fire a Generic event" to "Fire a Issue Resolved event". Ensure you do this for all resolve issue transitions in all workflows, and do not forget to publish the workflows after the changes have been made in order for the changes to take effect
fields.summary: JSD default/generated workflow, "Resolve this issue" transition is firing Generic Event

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Permission helper shows "does not have the 'Create Issues' permission" for Service Desk customers
The Service Desk override says that Service Desk does not override this permission. This statement may be accurate due to the way Service Desk works but the customer can create issues so this is misleading.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Customer user
# Confirm that the custom is able to create issues
# Check the permission with the permission helper

h3. Expected Results
Permission helper should show that user has permission to create issues 

h3. Actual Results
Shows that user does not have Create Issues permission despite having just created an issue through the portal
 
h3. Notes
The attachment shows an issue that was created in the Customer Portal by user "mex test"
Permission helper used on that same issue, "mex test" user, Create Issues permission.
Shows that user does not have Create Issues permission despite having just created an issue through the portal.
fields.summary: Permission helper shows customers cannot create issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1526].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The reports based on Metric called Resolution would not give any results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Dummy ServiceDesk project and navigate to the "SLA" tab.
# Create a "New Metric" called "Resolution".
# Configure the Metric, for example:
!res.PNG|thumbnail!
# Create a several issues which met the Metric Goals.
# Change the system date to make those ticket breached and resolve the ticket to stop the SLA timer.
# Then, navigate to "Reports" tab and create a "New Report"
# Add a series and configured like in the screenshot below:
!report.PNG|thumbnail!
# Save the report.

h3. Expected Results
The graph and number will be updated with all breached issue created before.

h3. Actual Results
The graph is not updated and the number of breached issue still "0".
!graph.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* The same results will be thrown with "Met" condition
* It is possible that it is due to the same name with the Resolution System Field
fields.summary: Reports based on Metric called Resolution would not give any results.

Error when creating Service Desk request with Notify Hipchat post function in Create Issue transition. This might be related to having username that has a combination of uppercase and lowercase letter as well. 


*Steps to Reproduce* 
# Access Customer Portal with a Username that has combination of uppercase and lowercase letters. 
# Tried to create a request with *Notify Hipchat* post function in the create issue transition 
# Getting an error 
!error.PNG|thumbnail!
# JIRA logs is showing 
{noformat}

        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager$$anonfun$initializeWorkflow$1$$anonfun$apply$1.apply(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:56)
        at scalaz.$bslash$div$class.flatMap(Either.scala:117)

Dear Support, 

we want to use Jira Service Desk for our agents, but something important ist mossing, maybe I did not find the right answers yes:

1.) MANDATORY: tickets shall be reopened, if the ticket is closed / resolved and the customers adds a new comment in the customer portal
2.) would be good: customers should be able to close a ticket in the portal
3.) IMPORTANT: We want to have prepared answers that we can use to anser tickets with prepared text tempates -- this is tracked via https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.


Thank you for your answer.

I was looging e.g. for the answer for question 1 for many hours without success.

We have installed the latest version of jira service desk on our server.


br
Markus Häusler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1517].
  {panel}

Allow customers with JIRA Users global permission to access requests through JIRA instead of customer portal

*As an administrator*, I would like my customers, who also have JIRA Users global permission, to be able to access Service Desk requests from the regular JIRA interface instead of having to go to the customer portal. 

*As a customer*, who also uses JIRA as a JIRA User, I would like to be able to access Service Desk requests reported by myself.
* I need to be able to search for requests in issue navigator. 
** For example, when searching using JQL "reporter = currentUser()" all of my JIRA issues should be returned, including Service Desk requests.

*Use Example:*
* As a customer, I have create issue permission to a Service Desk project and created a new Service Desk Request using JIRA's create issue interface. I am now unable to find that issue when searching in issue navigator. I should be able to find the issue I reported.

----

This feature request is to make it so that they can at least "access" the issues from JIRA, and does not seek to specify how that access is given.
* For example: When accessing an issue from JIRA, the customer could be taken to the JIRA issue view or they could be directed to the issue in the Customer Portal. 
* Please feel free to add comments to this suggestion with how you would like to see this access implemented

One workaround that is currently in use would be JIRA administrators giving customers Browse Project permission so that the customers can view issues in JIRA. This causes Service Desk permission errors to appear and also gives customers access to internal comments.
fields.summary: Allow customers with JIRA Users global permission to access requests through JIRA instead of customer portal

fields.description:
Service Desk is not respecting the default value in a select list.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a custom select list field with a default value;
- Add the field to the Customer Portal, as required
- When creating a ticket the "None" option should not be displayed.

That's the opposite from [JSD-364|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-364].
fields.summary: Portal shows None option for single select list when it is required and has a default value

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1515].
{panel}
 
||Update 3.7.x||
|This feature is currently available and you can read about it here : [https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-7-x-release-notes-934718353.html#JIRAServiceDesk3.7.xreleasenotes-Cannedresponses]
I am marking this ticket as resolved.
Thank you,
Jira Service Desk|

 

 

Agents should have the ability to create a signature for their responses to Service Desk customers to prevent having to copy/paste or type out a signature for each response.

There may be a use case for the ability to set these signatures per agent per service desk, also.

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Paging does not work properly in Customer Portal view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Test Customer in a test instance
# Have Test Customer create 10 requests & Add him as Request Participants in 30 other requests
# In Customer Portal view, *Created by me* lists the 10 requests and *Created by others* shows the first 20 requests
# Clicking page 2, *Created by me* lists 0 issues and *Created by others* list does not change 

h3. Expected Results
- 2nd page should show the remaining 10 issues for *Created by others*

h3. Actual Results
- The list does not change on the 2nd page for *Created by others*
fields.summary: Paging does not work properly in Customer Portal View

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1512].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Apply JIRA Service desk to an existing project that has 30 days+ old issues.
# Navigate to the SLA reports in JIRA Service Desk and select SLA met vs breached report.

h3. Expected Behavior:

The report should present the breached issues for the past 7 days, 14 days, 30 days, etc accordingly.

h3. Actual Behavior:

The report is actually counting older issues as breached with the date the service desk was applied to the project and not with the correct date when it was really breached.

As you can see on the screenshot below, the project in question had breached issues on October 2014. After applied the the Service Desk to this project it's now counting as breached with the date the Service Desk was applied to the project (Feb 13th).

!Breached.png!

!Report.png!

h3. Workaround:

No available workarounds.
fields.summary: SLA Report not working as expected (SLA met vs breached)

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When enabling Service Desk for a normal project, there will be an error viewing the issue if that particular issue has a comment made by *Anonymous* users

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a normal project
# Give *Group (Anyone)* permission to browse project and comment on issue
# Create an issue in the project
# Have an anonymous user (not logged in) comment on that issue
# Enable Service Desk for the project
# View that particular issue in the Issue Navigator

h4. Expected Results
# Everything works normally
# Able to view the issue without any errors

h4. Actual Results
# When viewing the issue in the Issue Navigator, there will be the following error
!1.png|thumbnail!
# The following stacktrace is found in the logs:
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1505].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JSD should not consider comments without the {{sd.public.comment}} attribute as internal comments, but as public comments. Only comments with the entity property set to false should be considered private.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk enabled project;
# Create a customer request;
# Add a comment as an external AC or a P2 addon

h3. Expected Results
The comment should be added as public.

h3. Actual Results
the issue becomes shown as an Internal comment which is not accurate
 
h3. Notes
I suspect the reason this occurs is because the Comment did not have an entity property {{sd.public.comment}} which is what JSD seems to use to differentiate between internal and public comments.
fields.summary: Comments added to issues by addons are listed as internal by default

*Current Behaviour*
If a custom field _Select List (single choice)_ is added to the screen and make it required. Required field are pre-filled when form is opened in Customer Portal.

!Custom Field.png|thumbnail!

*Feature Request*
If a custom field _Select List (single choice)_ is added to the screen and make it required. Required filed should be empty when form is opened in Customer Portal.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1501].
  {panel}

# When creating an issue via Service Desk that has the *Attachment* field, you will be able to upload an attachment
!Screen Shot 2015-02-11 at 14.59.33.jpg|thumbnail!
!Screen Shot 2015-02-11 at 14.59.52.jpg|thumbnail!
# However, when creating the ticket, you will see once it has been created, no attachment is added.
!Screen Shot 2015-02-11 at 15.00.00.jpg|thumbnail!
# Navigate to the issue in JIRA, and there is no evidence of an attachment ever having been added. 
!Screen Shot 2015-02-11 at 15.00.12.jpg|thumbnail!

*Workaround:*

Please ask Support to install a fixed version of the add-on. JIRA will need to be restarted to perform the installation, so please provide the date, time and timezone for a 15 minute window for the downtime.

The permanent fix is planned for the scheduled weekly release on the 16th of February

*Note:* 
-- It is still possible to add attachments after the issue has been created.
-- Send an email with attachments to create a new request, the attachments are attached successfully with the request.
fields.summary: Customers unable to attach files when creating Service Desk Portal tickets

A customer would like to know how JIRA Service Desk authenticates as opposed to JIRA. 

This is related to  a 3rd party integration with Duo Security (  https://www.duosecurity.com/docs/jira )

At the moment, this integration works fine with JIRA but there are some issues with JIRA Service Desk.

I can't find any documentation related to Service Desk authenticates at the moment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1497].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

when a user that does not exist in JIRA as a Service Desk Customer sends an email to a Service Desk, the user receives an invite to sign up for the Service Desk as a Customer. JIRA Service Desk should allow for JIRA Service Desk Administrators to chose whether or not they want customer accounts to be automatically created. Subsequently instead of sending an invite, an email should be sent asking them to finish the signup process.

h3. Environment
Server / Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce current behavior
# Send an email to a Service Desk you do not have access to or do not exist in as a Service Desk Customer

h3. Expected Results
- If the Service Desk Administrator has not selected the option, you should receive an email asking you to sign up for the specific Service Desk
- If the Service Desk Administrator has selected the option, you should receive an email asking you to complete the signup process


h3. Actual Results
- JIRA Service Desk automatically sends an email asking you to sign up for the specific Service Desk

h3.Workaround
Current JIRA Service Desk Administators can manually create accounts for users and then manually add them to the JIRA Service Desk Customers role
fields.summary: Ability to add JIRA Service Desk Customers automatically when issues are created via email

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1494].
  {panel}

In some cases, a customer may have more than one email (a personal email, and a company email for example.)

If a Service Desk administrator creates a customer profile for the company email, the Service Desk requests will be associated with this user profile.
If the customer sends an email to Service Desk with his personal email, it will create another user profile, and will have Requests different requests associated with each user profile.

As a Service Desk Administrator, I would like to merge the customer profiles, to avoid confusion when a customer have more than one email, then the customer will be able to see requests from both profiles.
fields.summary: Ability to merge customer profile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1492].
  {panel}

There is a JAVA Script error in the Internal Comment tab of Service Desk interface:

{code:java}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'indexOf' of undefined
a
(anonymous function)
d.event.dispatchbatch
d.event.add.g.handle.i
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce.

# Open a Google Chrome browser session, or any other browser with JAVA Console.
# Create a Service Desk.
# Create a request.
# Open the request in the Service Desk interface.
# Click in the comment field, then select the Internal Comment tab with the JAVA Console opened.

!Screen Shot 2015-02-10 at 11.02.21 AM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1491].
  {panel}

At the moment if Service Desk is included in the {{to}} field of an email thread, each reply will generate a new ticket in Service Desk.

*Steps to reproduce*
# As a Service Desk Customer, write a new email to User1 and ServiceDesk email.
** User1 should be an agent
# As User1 now reply to the email received from the Customer, include the same Service Desk email. (ie. Reply to All)
# As Customer reply to this thread once more using Reply to All.
*Result*
Three tickets will be created in Service Desk, each with the email body.
fields.summary: Service Desk should recognise it's being included in an Email Thread

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1489].
  {panel}

This bug caused partially broken state for few email configurations while migrating over to new email infrastructure. The symptom is
- Missing configuration
- Re-adding configuration using same email address won't work (the error message should be the same as attachment)

This bug doesn't affect functionalities of migrated, newly created email configuration.

After the Cloud Service Desk release on February 8th, 2015, SD Email Server had its configuration missing. Customers tried to add it back (JIRA Service Desk Name >> Settings >> Email Settings) but the following error shows up:
!error.png|thumbnail!
It reads:
{noformat}
Error
Unable to create new mail channel due to connection duplication. Provided mail connection definition is currently used by another mail channel.
{noformat}

When checking the SD Email Handler, we can see this:
!error2.png|thumbnail!
It reads:
{noformat}
Mail handler used by JIRA Service Desk. Do not modify or delete. 10,306
Service Desk Mail Handler Local Files SD_MAIL_SERVER_ID: 10306
{noformat}

On the logs we found:
{code}2015-02-09 15:58:31.607473500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607474500 	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.squalor.email.ServiceDeskMailFetcherService.runImpl(ServiceDeskMailFetcherService.java:87)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607483500 	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.file.AbstractMessageHandlingService.run(AbstractMessageHandlingService.java:263)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607484500 	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:66)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607484500 	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runService(ServiceRunner.java:76)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607485500 	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runServiceId(ServiceRunner.java:54)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607486500 	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runJob(ServiceRunner.java:37)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607486500 	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:136)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607487500 	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:101)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607490500 	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:80)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607491500 	at com.atlassian.scheduler.quartz1.Quartz1Job.execute(Quartz1Job.java:32)
2015-02-09 15:58:31.607491500 	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:223){code}

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In JIRA Service Desk, the comment field on a transition screen has no id:
<textarea name="comment" class="textarea sd-comment-textarea mentionable" data-issuekey="DESK-1"></textarea>

As a consequence any message from a workflow validator is NOT shown.

Instead the html code for that textarea should look something like this:
<textarea name="comment" id="comment" class="textarea sd-comment-textarea mentionable" data-issuekey="DESK-1"></textarea>


Background:
People would like to use the 'Field required' validator from the plugin 'JIRA Suite Utilities' to ensure the users enter a comment.
On a non-JSD project this is working fine. In a JSD project, I can see with the debugger, that the proper InvalidInputException is thrown from the validator if no comment is entered.
However the message won't be shown on the transition screen, because the comment textarea is missing the id. The user will just stuck on the transition screen without a message.

=> Please add the id="comment" to that textarea.
fields.summary: id attribute missing on comment field -> 3rd party validator not working properly

Currently the error is displayed only once we navigate to the Service Desk Plugin. This can induce the customer that the permission has been properly applied to the Service Desk Project when it's not.

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/598273/mI6XvvbSoiR2ANS/illegal_permission_error.png!

Thanks!

L.F

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1479].
  {panel}

The following is a good feature to have 

When an SD project is associated to an email, the mail handler will scan the mail contents to look for key words. Then they will auto-assign the tickets based on these key words. For example:
* If an email is received with the word ‘hardware’ the ticket will be automatically assigned to Anna Smith
* If an email is received with the word ‘software’ the ticket will be automatically assigned to Jim Jones
* If an email is received with the word ‘password’ the ticket will be automatically assigned to Anil Kim
fields.summary: Auto-Assign request to specific agents based on key words in the email contents

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1477].
  {panel}

Customer needs to disable the strip quotes as service desk strips a lot of context if Agents need to follow-up on tickets. 
Most of their clients communicate via the email channel and since SD is stripping these, they loose a lot of information/context for the topic in-hand.
Further more, it is not possible to edit the mail handler which has been created by service desk in JIRA.
Customer's description is available in the first comment.
fields.summary: Having Option to Disable Strip Quotes for JIRA Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1476].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 17 August 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Portal @ mentions is available in JSM Data Center version [4.18|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-18-x-release-notes-1072467369.html#JiraServiceManagement4.18.xreleasenotes-cpimprovements]+. We are also working on shipping this functionality for JSM Cloud in the short-term, which you can follow progress for on this ticket: JSDCLOUD-1476.

Kind regards,

Charlie
 Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center
{panel}
h3. Summary

When adding a comment to a JIRA Service Desk request, the @mention feature does not work for customers or request participants unless those users have permission to browse the project (basically being considered agents) or if they have made a comment on the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Service Desk
 # Have a customer create a request
 # As an administrator, view the issue in the Issue Navigator
 # Type a comment and use the @mention feature to mention the customer

h3. Desired Results
 * A list of suggestions will appear which you can choose the customer or all the request participant, regardless if they have made a comment or not.

h3. Actual Results
 * A list of users appears but this list does not contain the customer or any request participants unless they have made a comment.
 ** Agents and collaborators do appear in the list. Any customers and request participants who are agents or collaborators will appear.

h3. Workaround

*(i) Please note that this functionality is available in Jira Service Management Data Center version 4.18+*
 * Add them manually using markup and Service Desk will notify them as if you had used the normal @mention method:
{code:java}
[~username]
{code}

 * Have the participant make a comment, and they will be mention-able after that.
fields.summary: Unable to @mention Customer or Request Participant

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Service Desk notifications to customers are sent when a bulk operation is performed despite "Send mail for this update" being unchecked.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few issues in a Service Desk Project;
 # Run a simple filter to retrieve these issues;
 # Run a bulk edit operation, to transition these issues and uncheck the "Send mail for this update" box.

h3. Expected Results

No notifications should be sent
h3. Actual Results

On the final move screen a message appears: "Email notifications will NOT be sent for this update."
 Notifications are still sent to customers
h3. Workaround

There is no proper workaround for this issue, though there are 2 options available:
 # Shortly disable the outgoing mail server, however this might also impact any other events that require notifications from JIRA.
 # Shortly disable Service Desk notifications. This is less intrusive than option 1 however could still impact notifications on other events than the bulk operation.
fields.summary: Bulk operations send notifications to customers when "Send mail for this update" is unchecked

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1474].
  {panel}

Results in the Queue may go beyond the JIRA screen when many columns are selected

The results in the Queues in a Service Desk may go beyond the JIRA navigation bar when many columns are selected. See the screenshot below:
!queue_layout_broken.png!

We should restrict the size so that the results are scrolling inside the JIRA screen boundaries (not beyond header/navigation bar and footer).

This also happens on the Issue Navigator and might be related to [JRA-41948|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41948].
fields.summary: Results in the Queue may go beyond the JIRA screen when many columns are selected

fields.summary: Unable to create API issues with Portal Access users as the reporter

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1472].
  {panel}

the main customer portal orders the project in alphabetical order of the Service Desk name. At the moment we do not have the feature to reorder it.

There are several cases where admin needs to rearrange/reorder the service desk projects in the main customer portal (servicedesk/customer/portals). 
For example want to add to top of list most used and important for our users portals.

Thus, it could be better to allow the admin to be able to rearrange/reorder the service desk projects in customer portal
fields.summary: Ability to rearrange Service Desk project on the main customer portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1470].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
After enabling JIRA Service Desk email channel in a restricted access project, email messages sent from unregistered email addresses are not processed. There is no way to get the list of emails that the system failed to process. 

*Feature Request* 
After enabling JIRA Service Desk email channel in a restricted access project, email messages sent from unregistered email addresses are not processed. There should be a way to get the list of emails that the system failed to process.
fields.summary: Ability to get the list of emails that the system failed to process

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1466].
  {panel}

Currently, if Service Desk agent creates a Service Desk Issue from within JIRA as opposed to Service Desk, and set the reporter to the Service Desk customer, that issue will not be available for the customer to view in *My Request* in the user's customer portal.

The desired behaviour is to have the issue reported by the user to show in the *My Request* in the user's customer portal.

h3. Workaround
As stated in this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Convert+Existing+Issues+to+Service+Desks+Requests], the possible workaround is to convert existing issues to service desk requests
fields.summary: Make Request available for customer in 'My Requests' in Service Desk if ticket is created from JIRA

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1465].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JIRA + JSD project running
# Turn JSD notification on
# Raise a ticket on customer's behalf (set customer as the reporter)
## Comment on this issue
## Change issue's status

*Expected Results:*
# Reporter/Customer should be notified when a comment is added on the issue (3.1)
# Reporter/Customer should be notified when there is a change in the request's status (3.2)

*Actual Results:*
# No notification is sent to Reporter/Customer regarding the issue.

*Workaround:*
-Disable JIRA Service Desk notification (Cog Icon > Add-ons > JIRA Service Desk Configuration), this way, JIRA notification scheme will work as defined for all events and users.-

*Notes:*
The notifications aren't working for Request Participants as well.

Documentation of JSD Notifications: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Configuring+JIRA+Service+Desk+notifications
fields.summary: Reporter/Customer doesn't receive any notification when ticket is created on his/her behalf (JIRA + JSD)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1464].
  {panel}

As the administrator of one or more service desks, I would like the ability to enable and disable access to the portal during maintenance periods and other times where customers/agents should not be able to access the portal. 
* As the administrator I should be able to access the portal while customer/agent access is disabled
* I need to be able to disable access for only customers or both agents and customers
** Use Case: I am training my agents on a new service desk and want it available to agents without being available to customers
fields.summary: Ability to enable and disable customer and/or agent access to portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1463].
  {panel}

At the moment, after SLA stops, any changes in the issue will not automatically adjust SLA counted.

For example:
- Issue is initially created with priority Major which has SLA of *4 hours*. 
- After resolving the issue (after *3 hours of work*, and the resolution is set), SLA will stop and be marked as *MET*. Since it's resolved within the SLA
- If the customer later changes the priority to Blocked (which has *1 hour* of SLA), the SLA is still considered as *MET* and it is not automatically adjusted as *BREACHED*

Customer might implement or use SLA in different scenario. It would be better to allow them to choose if they want the SLA to be automatically adjusted when they edit the issue (priority) even after the SLA has stopped.
fields.summary: Allow SLA to be automatically adjusted when user changes issue priority even after the SLA stops.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1462].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
Currently raising requests in behalf of the customers can only be set when agent create the request.

*Feature Request*
Ability to raise request on behalf of the customer through email. Agent set the customer's email address in the reply-to-field and mail handler should process it as customer as the reporter.
fields.summary: Raise request on behalf of customer through email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1460].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install JIRA (I used 6.3.14) and JIRA Service Desk (I used version 2.2.0)
# Use the old format license key (before 2.0) for JIRA Service desk
# Set up a few Service desks on the instance 
# Make sure the Service desks are working
# Now change the license for JIRA Service Desk to the new version 2.0 license
# Re-index the instance
# Notice that the Service desks configured earlier have now disappeared. The projects for these service desks exist but the Service desk is lost.
fields.summary: Servicedesks disappear after changing to the new version 2.0 license

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1459].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms
The columns in the JIRA Service Desk queue are not being displayed.
!columns_due_date_hidden.png!

Looking into the Javascript Console, the error below can be seen.
!Console.png!

There are no errors in the JIRA nor in the Service Desk logs.

h3. Steps to Replicate
Hide any of the fields configured as columns in the Service Desk Queue from on the Field Configuration screen.

In the screenshot below, hiding any of the fields below (e.g. Due date, Reporter, Summary) in the [Field Configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Specifying+Field+Behavior#SpecifyingFieldBehavior-Hidingorshowingafield] screen would cause this error.
!columns_okay.png!

h3. Workaround
Make the fields associated to the affected Service Desk project queue visible.
fields.summary: Columns missing on service desk queue due to hidden fields on selected columns
